revised_title: Electromotive Changes in the Mammalian Spinal Cord following Electrical Excitation of the Cortex Cerebri
tldr: The authors conducted experiments to study the electromotive changes in the mammalian spinal cord following electrical excitation of the cortex cerebri. They used a sensitive Lippmann's capillary electrometer to detect the changes and found that the mammalian nerve showed a marked difference or demarcation current. The results provide insights into the relationship between the cortex and the spinal cord in the production of epileptic sequences.
